CONTRACT HAS NOT GONE THROUGH ANY SECURITY REVIEW. DO NOT USE IN PROD.For details on its operation, see the offchain reporting protocol design doc, which refers to this contract as simply the \"contract\".This contract is meant to aid rapid development of new applications based on OCR2. However, for actual production contracts, it is expected that most of the logic of this contract will be folded directly into the application contract. Inheritance prevents us from doing lots of juicy storage layout optimizations, leading to a substantial increase in gas cost.","kind":"dev","methods":{"latestConfigDetails()":{"returns":{"blockNumber":"block at which this config was set","configCount":"ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far","configDigest":"domain-separation tag for current config (see configDigestFromConfigData)"}},"latestConfigDigestAndEpoch()":{"returns":{"configDigest":"configDigest","epoch":"epoch","scanLogs":"indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead."}},"setConfig(address[],address[],uint8,bytes,uint64,bytes)":{"params":{"_f":"number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate","_offchainConfig":"encoded off-chain oracle configuration","_offchainConfigVersion":"version number for offchainEncoding schema","_onchainConfig":"encoded on-chain contract configuration","_signers":"addresses with which oracles sign the reports","_transmitters":"addresses oracles use to transmit the reports"}},"transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],bytes32[],bytes32)":{"params":{"rawVs":"ith element is the the V component of the ith signature","report":"serialized report, which the signatures are signing.","rs":"ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries","ss":"ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Alternatively, the contract may use latestConfigDigestAndEpoch with scanLogs set to false."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"acceptOwnership()":{"notice":"Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient."},"latestConfigDetails()":{"notice":"information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration"},"latestConfigDigestAndEpoch()":{"notice":"optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. returns.blockNumber: block at which this config was set
returns.configCount: ordinal number of current config, out of all configs applied to this contract so far
returns.configDigest: domain-separation tag for current config (see configDigestFromConfigData)

returns.scanLogs: indicates whether to rely on the configDigest and epoch returned or whether to scan logs for the Transmitted event instead.

params._f: number of faulty oracles the system can tolerate
params._signers: addresses with which oracles sign the reports
params._transmitters: addresses oracles use to transmit the reports

params.rawVs: ith element is the the V component of the ith signature
params.report: serialized report, which the signatures are signing.
params.rs: ith element is the R components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries
params.ss: ith element is the S components of the ith signature on report. Must have at most maxNumOracles entries

transmitters().details: The list will match the order used to specify the transmitter during setConfig

returns._0: list of addresses permitted to transmit reports to this contract

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

latestConfigDetails().notice: information about current offchain reporting protocol configuration

latestConfigDigestAndEpoch().notice: optionally returns the latest configDigest and epoch for which a report was successfully transmitted. Alternatively, the contract may return scanLogs set to true and use Transmitted events to provide this information to offchain watchers.

setConfig(address[],address[],uint8,byte.notice: sets offchain reporting protocol configuration incl. participating oracles

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

transmit(bytes32[3],bytes,bytes32[],byte.notice: transmit is called to post a new report to the contract

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256,address,uint64,address[] memory,address[] memory,uint8,bytes memory,uint64,bytes memory) pure returns (bytes32)

documentation.text:
@return list of addresses permitted to transmit reports to this contract
 @dev The list will match the order used to specify the transmitter during setConfig
